result.execSummary:
The defendant Rey S Mendoza Cervantes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
STAYED.
Straight time.
Consecutive to: Counts 2 and 3

Probation may be transferred to Milwaukee County.
Concurrent with: Counts 2 and 3

miscConds.notes: Restitution of $15.00 to Mark K. - as a Condition of Probation. (and surcharges)

Court costs and DNA surcharge to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No contact with the victims or their residences.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

timeConds.notes:
Condition Time - FORTHWITH. 90 days credit given.
Last 60 days - Huber (nonworking) standard release.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Rey S Mendoza Cervantes in court, in custody, with attorney John Paul Marchan.   Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended Information filed. Reading waived.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1, 2 and 3.  Court finds defendant guilty.

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
-  7 months jail straight time consecutive to Cts. 2 and 3 STAYED for 2 years Probation - concurrent to Cts. 2 and 3. Probation may be transferred to Milwaukee County.  
- Court Costs of $243.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- Restitution of $15.00 to be paid to Mark K. to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
- DNA Surcharge of $200.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Conditions of  Probation: AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling. Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s..   Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No drug paraphernalia. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; Inform Agent of all prescriptions. Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling.  No contact with the victims or their residence.  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
 - 180 days jail Condition Time - 90 days credit commencing forthwith. Last 60 days jail with huber condition time (nonworking hours).   Non-working hours with standard release conditions. 

Ct. 2:
-  7 months jail straight time consecutive to Cts. 1 and 3 STAYED for 2 years Probation - concurrent to Cts. 1 and 3. Probation may be transferred to Milwaukee County.  
- Court Costs of $243.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- DNA Surcharge of $200.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Conditions of  Probation: AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling. Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s..   Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No drug paraphernalia. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; Inform Agent of all prescriptions. Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling.  No contact with the victims or their residence.  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
 
Ct. 3:
-  7 months jail straight time consecutive to Cts. 1 and 2 STAYED for 2 years Probation - concurrent to Cts. 1 and 2. Probation may be transferred to Milwaukee County.  
- Court Costs of $243.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- DNA Surcharge of $200.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Conditions of  Probation: AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling. Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s..   Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No drug paraphernalia. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; Inform Agent of all prescriptions. Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling.  No contact with the victims or their residence.  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 23, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Rey S Mendoza Cervantes in court, in custody, with attorney John Paul Marchan.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court addresses request from the defendant for bail bond hearing. Request is withdrawn. Defense requests a date for plea/sentencing the week of July 20th, 2015. Court grants request.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Inmate Communication letter; requesting a bail modification hearing

Defendant Rey S Mendoza Cervantes in court, in custody, with attorney John Paul Marchan.   Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense has yet to receive discovery.  Atty. Marchan requests time to obtain discovery and review with his client.  Hearing scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Rey S Mendoza Cervantes in court, in custody, with attorney John Paul Marchan.   Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.    Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Attorney Marchan states the defendant does not need an interpreter.    Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
